elements.title: Pororari River (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the hiking track through the Pororari River gorge has become part of New Zealand's newest Great Walk, the Paparoa Track (video featured)?

elements.title: One More Cup of Coffee (Valley Below) (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bob Dylan poked Emmylou Harris when he wanted her to start singing during the recording of "One More Cup of Coffee (Valley Below)"?

elements.title: Skirmish at Top Malo House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that two Argentine commandos were awarded their nation's highest honour for the Skirmish at Top Malo House?

elements.title: Motion Pictures in Education (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1923 book Motion Pictures in Education is among the first major works about using films to teach students?

elements.title: Stanley Shaldon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stanley Shaldon upset manufacturers by reusing dialysis machines?

elements.title: the soundtrack (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the soundtrack for the 2016 film Arrival, composed by Jóhann Jóhannsson, was ruled ineligible for contention at the 89th Academy Awards due to the film's prominent inclusion of a Max Richter piece?

elements.title: Eleanor Glanville (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 17th-century entomologist Eleanor Glanville raised her own moths and butterflies, and wrote some of the earliest detailed descriptions of butterfly rearing?

elements.title: Park Avenue Plaza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Park Avenue Plaza is not on Park Avenue and does not have a plaza?
